---
title: "Urban Growth, Decline, and The Great Divergence"
---

## Overview

This lecture examines why some cities grow while others decline, and explores the "Great Divergence" - the increasing gap between prosperous, productive cities and struggling ones. We'll analyze the factors that drive urban success and failure.

## Key Topics

- Determinants of urban growth
  - Human capital and education
  - Innovation and technology
  - Industry composition and specialization
  - Quality of life and amenities

- Urban decline
  - Deindustrialization
  - Loss of comparative advantage
  - Population outflows and the fiscal crisis
  - Path dependence and persistence

- The Great Divergence
  - Rising inequality between cities
  - Superstar cities vs. lagging regions
  - Skill sorting across places
  - Policy responses to divergence

- Using tidycensus to access demographic data
